column4: I have a hard drive icon on my desktop that I can't figure out how to change?
anyone know how to rename a hard drive icon on the desktop?
you have to change a value in the registry, would you like me to walk you though it?
yes please. I wasn't aware of linux having a registry
well its more a gnome registry.. first press alt-f2 and type gconf-editor
I figured that's what you were talking about, got it open
now go to apps->nautilus->desktop
ok
and uncheck the value 'volumes visible'
why is that? I'll do it but I would just like an explaination
WOW, they are all gone.
it will hide the hard drive icon on your desktop, that is what you want no?
no, I want to change a name of 1 of them.
oh.. sorry! then think you need to change the mount point in /etc/fstab
nope, mount is correct but it's showing me some weird name
it's showing as DRV8_VOL1. really strange?
ya thats kind of strange alright
any suggestions?
is it called something completely different in /etc/fstab?
it's wrong under Places also. but when I look in /dev/disk/by-label there is only 1 symlink pointing to that drive's device id which is /dev/hdb1. do you think I can just delete that symlink?
I actually just noticed this now!!! this might be the solution I hope.
let us know if it works :)
so you think that's it? No damage if I delete it?
